definitions.definition: An act or instance of lending, an act or instance of granting something for temporary use.
definitions.example: Because of the loan that John made to me, I was able to pay my tuition for the upcoming semester.

definitions.definition: A sum of money or other property that a natural or legal person borrows from another with the condition that it be returned or repaid over time or at a later date (sometimes with interest).
definitions.example: All loans from the library, whether books or audio material, must be returned within two weeks.

definitions.definition: The contract and array of legal or ethical obligations surrounding a loan.
definitions.example: He made a payment on his loan.

definitions.definition: The permission to borrow any item.
definitions.example: Thank you for the loan of your lawn mower.
